events.name: Google Cloud Next '18 Extended - Santo Domingo

venue.name: Plaza Madelta II
venue.address_1: Ave. Romulo Betancourt no. 325, Bella Vista

events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

events.name: Live Streaming: Introducci√≥n a Android Jetpack y AndroidX

En el Google I/O del a√±o 2017 Google introdujo nuevos componentes de arquitectura, esto represent√≥ una revoluci√≥n en como se construyen las aplicaciones Android.

Un a√±o despu√©s en el √∫ltimo Google I/O, develaron que esos componentes eran parte de algo mayor llamado Android Jetpack, un conjunto de componentes y principios para crear arquitecturas robustas y por tanto aplicaciones estables y sobre todo escalables.

https://developer.android.com/jetpack/

events.name: Google I/O Extended Santo Domingo
events.description:
El GDG Santo Domingo trae para toda la comunidad el evento I/O Extended 2019. En el I/O Extended estaremos recapitulando sobre los anuncios m√°s importantes de Google en el pasado Google I/O. Veremos que trae de nuevo el gigante tecnol√≥gico desde el punto de vista de desarrollo m√≥vil, cloud computing, entre otros interesantes temas.

- Google I/O 2019 Recap
- GDG Santo Domingo y los pr√≥ximos eventos

- Networking

NOTA IMPORTANTE

events.name: Google Cloud Next Extended: Santo Domingo 2019
events.description:
Google Cloud Next es el evento m√°s grande sobre tecnolog√≠as en la nube de la plataforma Google Cloud. Este a√±o algunos miembros del GDG Santo Domingo se dieron cita el pasado mes de Abril en el evento realizado en San Francisco, California.

Registrate a tiempo y asegura tu cupo!

Agenda:

1. Introducci√≥n

2. Go on Serverless

3. Cloud build + container registry + app engine: despliega tu app r√°pido y sin mucho esfuerzo

4. Terraform GCP

5. Introducci√≥n a Firebase

6. The Google Next Experience (Panel)

7. Networking

events.name: How to build a Reactive Server Under an hour
events.description:
En esta ocacion tenemos un invitado especial quien estuvo participando en https://jconfdominicana.org/

Oleh Dokuka
Mainly Java Software Engineer / Consultant focused on distributed systems development adopting ReactiveManifesto and ReactiveProgramming techniques.

The motivation for this talk is showing the basics of development of Reactive Server server from scratch which teaches the audience the basics of non-blocking I/O in java and shows the power of Reactive Programming with Project Reactor and teaches the audience the API available within Project Reactor

In this speech, we are going to talk about developing your own server using pure Non-Blocking Java API. First of all, we will start with the reason why non-blocking is important in the development of modern web applications. Smoothly moving from that point, we will cover the central challenges of building non-blocking servers. In turn, we will introduce the Reactive Programming technique for simplification our code and be turning everyday software development into the art. Since Java Non-Blocking API is nothing more than actions‚Äô execution and reacting to asynchronous responses, we will see how simple become development of complicated things with the usage of Reactive Programming with Project Reactor.

group_profile.intro: GDG Santo Domingo is a open group to share knowledge and experiences.
